a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Expected share of deaths from non-communicable diseases, by gender, 2019
The estimated share of 30-year-olds who would die before their 70th birthday from common non-communicable
diseases: any of cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes, or chronic respiratory disease.
Data source: WHO, Global Health Observatory (2022)
Note: Estimates assume that current mortality rates continue and they would not have already died from any other cause of death (e.g.,
